lender.name: Jeffrey
lender.loan_because: It can make a difference.

lender.name: J.Starkey
lender.loan_because: Its the best method I've found for successfully assisting people, families, communities, countries out of famine - one person at a time. Its a domino effect. "You feed a man a fish - you feed him for a day, You teach a man to fish - you feed him for a lifetime". If people have businesses generating income then they become self suficient and their businesses further create jobs in their communities - etc etc - a domino effect. One person at a time. Its do-able!

lender.name: Cheryl
lender.loan_because: I want to give people the opportunity I've been fortunate enough to have in my life and to honor my son Mikey who wanted to help people.

lender.name: Dan
lender.loan_because: If we don't share our wealth, they will share their poverty. - and It's the right thing to do.
lender.occupational_info: We make very precise equipment to measure the size of (mostly) continuous round stuff.

lender.name: Amanda
lender.loan_because: I want to help people achieve their goals.

lender.name: Sean
lender.loan_because: I believe this project is a great idea and I fully support it.
lender.occupational_info: Our organization is responsible for database management and mapping for our city and county agencies.

lender.name: Joan
lender.loan_because: I believe in the elimination of the extremes of poverty and wealth. I am fortunate to live in the wealthiest nation on the planet (materially). While we are rich in resources and material things, our spirits can be enriched through the sharing of our "wealth", and learning the secrets of the spirit that those people might share with us.

lender.name: nancy
lender.occupational_info: I am currently studying to be a designer. Interior designers decorated homes, office space, retail stores and more

lender.occupational_info: I am a photographer....

lender.name: Reputation
lender.loan_because:
The experts at Reputation Advocate, LLC provide comprehensive online reputation management to people from every walk of life. Based in Nashville, Tennessee, Reputation Advocate has assembled an experienced and talented team of advocates who are committed to defending their clients against negative and misleading information on the Web.
When a client retains the services of Reputation Advocate, the team works hard to document, track and influence what's been posted in blogs, forums and websites on the Internet. This is successfully accomplished by time-consuming and labor-intensive work, as Reputation Advocate creates new, positive content on multiple websites and social profiles to move damaging references off the initial pages of search results. Research shows that eighty-five percent of all searches do not go past that first page.
Helping a client to understand the need for a carefully managed timeline, Reputation Advocate continues to strengthen positive pages in order to move negative postings deep within search returns. With additional time and effort invested into an online reputation repair campaign, Reputation Advocate then provides further results. Increasing these positive references online pushes down the negative search results and result in a “clean” first page of Google.
Reputation Advocate serves as a valuable reputation resource to individuals, professionals and businesses when a negative search return could result in a lost customer, job opportunity or scholarship. For urgent online reputation management needs, Reputation Advocate’s FastTrack is a discreet and confidential tool. For simple problems, clients retain Reputation Advocate for a very specific one-time project. If a situation is more complicated, it may be necessary to contract Reputation Advocate for a longer-term annual service agreement.
Reputation Advocate does not allow its service to be used for illegal activities and reserves the right to take preventive or corrective actions to protect itself and its clients. Reputation Advocate also reserves the right to refuse service to anyone at any time. All prospective clients are expected to truthfully and accurately represent their identities. Visit the website of Reputation Advocate for more detailed information on Reputation Advocate’s terms and conditions of service, at http://www.reputationadvocate.com.
Although it is generally understood that bad things can happen to good people, Reputation Advocate does not believe that a single indiscretion should destroy a person’s life or follow them around for many years. Many times, negative postings exist because people are simply mean spirited. Reputation Advocate itself has been the target of phony complaint site postings by competitors attempting to hamper its ability to provide reputation repair services.
Reputation Advocate's offerings include immediate and long cycle strategies to meet each individual client’s particular needs. Reputation Advocate currently operates in North America with additional limited services provided in fifteen foreign countries. Reputation Advocate is recognized by the Better Business Bureau as a BBB Accredited Business. Learn more at http://www.bbb.org/.
For additional news about Reputation Advocate, contact Managing Director Steven Wyer at 888-229-0746, or visit http://reputationadvocate.com.
lender.occupational_info: About Reputation Advocate Steven Wyer serves as Managing Director for Reputation Advocate, LLC. Reputation Advocate focuses on confidential online reputation management for individuals and companies.

lender.name: Mohib Ahel al-Bayt
lender.loan_because:
It is narrated from the Holy Prophet [s] who said:
"When I ascended to the sky, I saw three lines written on the door of Heaven:
The first line: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful; I am Allah and there is no god save Me that My Grace preceeds My wrath.
The second line: In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent the Merciful; charity is repaid ten times and loan eighteen times, and regard for kinship thirty times.
The third line: He who understands My Rank and My Lordship should never accuse Me regarding sustenance."
-- Al - Ithna 'Ashariyeh, p. 85
